Key Arguments: The government is excluding itself from the demands of the bill while imposing it on citizens, which is seen as an attempt to silence dissent.
The bill violates the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR), particularly Article 19, which protects freedom of expression.
The bill undermines the right to self-determination as outlined in ICCPR Article 1, which is essential for economic, social, and cultural development.
The bill infringes on freedom of thought, conscience, and religion as per ICCPR Article 18(1).
The bill contradicts Australia's commitments under international human rights agreements and the Australian Human Rights Commission Act 1986.
Notable Quotes: I have absolutely zero faith in any government which excludes itself from having to follow the demands of this bill, but seeks to impose it on the Australian people to silence wrong think.
This bill is a violation of the human rights of Australians and should be soundly defeated.
